name: dismayingly
content:

in a way that makes you feel unhappy and disappointed: His presentation of women can be dismayingly passive. There seems to be dismayingly little international agreement on how to deal with the threat.
More examplesFewer examplesThe match gets off to a dismayingly poor start.It remains dismayingly easy to browse through the reports and find errors.Dismayingly, I was later told that the house I wanted had already been sold.The minister made it dismayingly clear that reducing the aid budget will be a priority.
